intro: Rondeletia buddleioides, commonly known as the golden rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with hairy stems and alternate leaves. Its flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological importance. It is cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
